thread.title: Passports Now Required at Puerto Este Border Near San Diego
thread.title_full: Passports Now Required at Puerto Este Border Near San Diego

title: Passports Now Required at Puerto Este Border Near San Diego
text:
Passports Now Required at Puerto Este Border Near San Diego September 18, 2015 
U.S. citizens traveling from San Diego to Mexico through the Puerto Este border crossing—a popular route for day-trippers and shoppers—now are required to show a passport. The Arizona Capital Times reports that Mexico is requiring travelers to complete a form and show a valid passport; those planning to stay longer than a week also must pay a $20 fee to obtain a six-month permit. The newly renovated border crossing is the only one at which passports are required, though the process may be waived during heavy-traffic times. 0
